comment.body: You can [make](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zalex.bit/?Post:12) ZeroNet links short, but you should post full links with `http://127.0.0.1:43110/...`

There is no desktop or online application. I haven't smartphone. Also, mobile connection is very bad here. So, for **my situation** - Signal is useless.
My opinion: if you want convenience - Telegram; safety - Tox or Ricochet.

@Martinv: it needs a phone...
Minus many of today's messengers - binding to the phone. This is why I don't really like Telegram, but at least it have nice desktop and online applications. WhatsApp requires smartphone with Internet connection to use web-client.

Я думаю, тебе пригодился бы [Enhanced ZeroBlog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/19k2nhubaYsDJNPHL6iNs3D2K9Mgj66P4R). Там есть возможность ставить теги и автоматичеки по тегам создавать содержание.
Это реально удобнее, чем раскидывать почты по разным тематическим блогам, а потом вручную делать содержание.
No, you need to "install" updates by yourself

@Martinv: For example, [how to](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:81:Changelog,+April+18,+2016) add searching feature for your old\outdated blog.

Owner of ZeroMePlus hasn't included updates from ZeroMe. 
ZeroMePlus is obsolete.
ZeroMail is not compatible with regular Clearnet E-Mail
[Slack for linux](https://slack.com/downloads/linux) - and what the problem?

If you upload images through the in-browser editor, it automatically converts and compresses images. If you want the GIF, copy the animation to a blog manually (`ZeroNet-path/data/1YourSite/img/...`) and paste the following code: `![alter-title-here](img/anim.gif)`
For example - [working animations in the my blog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zalex.bit/?Post:15).

Incredibly cool 0_0

> Wire's severs use *proprietary* software. 
>
> *Discord*

> everyone
@Tomas: I hope it was a joke

@Kaffie: I meant that [he despises Wire](http://127.0.0.1:43110/me.zeronetwork.bit/?Post/1GrEenUGRWnzaNZjR3XsQa6dQgdPDTyt7i/1V7usnfmabQXPSNC2zrCpF2ed2jDZaujS/1502266626) because it's proprietary ([actually, no](https://github.com/wireapp)), but he uses Discord.

@Kaffie: wake up. **Styromaniac** said about proprietary, **he** is outraged by this. Not me. I just don't understand why he complains about the proprietary "nature" of a one messenger, but at the same time he uses another proprietary one. I'm not saying that `proprietary = bad`

@Kaffie: Well, yes, there is no phrase "I'm outraged by this." But *I think*  that the phrase "I was informed that Wire's severs use proprietary software" has a negative color, considering that further he talks about the free/libre and open source messengers.
___
Perhaps, I wasn't very clear. There was a suggestion to use Wire in the comments. He said that there is a proprietary software and he suggested open source messengers. Of course, I don't speak Chinese, and even English isn't my native language, but *I still guess* that he doesn't like the proprietary software in this suggestion. Maybe I'm wrong.

And don't consider me a fanatic. I will not throw out the computer because it's impossible to install libreboot or because it doesn't work without binary blobs. I'm crazy, but not so much.
